queen_1: Being a queen... it's a role filled with both joy and heartache. Every kit that's born, I feel an overwhelming surge of love and protectiveness. I watch them take their first breath, open their eyes, and explore the world.

Yet, with that love comes immense responsibility. I am not just nurturing the next generation of warriors, but the very future of our Clan. Their every scrape, every cry, keeps me awake at night. Have I done enough?
Am I teaching them the right lessons?

The nursery can sometimes feel like a bubble, separated from the rest of the Clan. But every whisper, every decision made by the leaders, affects us deeply. For one day, these kits will face those very challenges outside.

Seeing them grow, becoming apprentices, and then warriors, fills my heart with pride. But it's also tinged with fear. Will they remember what they learned in the nursery? Will the world be kind to them?
It's a life of countless emotions, challenges, and rewards. But when I see them succeed, when I see them find their place in the Clan, all the sleepless nights and worries fade away.
For I know, I've played a part in shaping the Clan's future, one kit at a time.
unabashed_queen: Oh hello, y_c! Are you checking in on the kits today?
They're really so lovely. I know the others will tell you kits are annoying but it's worth it!
Oh, you should have seen r_a as a kit. {PRONOUN/r_a/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_a/were/was} so cute! One time, {PRONOUN/r_a/subject}-
[r_a passes by the nursery, dropping a mouthful of moss onto the floor as {PRONOUN/r_a/subject} {VERB/r_a/rush/rushes} in.]
Oh hello, r_a! I was just telling y_c about what you were like as a kit.
What do you mean, 'don't'? There's no need to be embarrassed, I think it was adorable!
queen_2: Come here, little one. Your fur is so spiky!
Hey! Don't run away from me!
queen_3: My dear kit, being a queen is a role woven from strands of love, sacrifice, and hope. When I look at you, so tiny and curious, my heart swells with dreams and wishes for your future.

But there's more to being in the nursery than just cuddles and playtime. We queens tell stories, teach values, and instill courage. We prepare little ones like you for the big world outside, with its challenges and triumphs.

Some nights, when the moon is high and you're nestled close, I wonder what kind of warrior you'll become. Will you be fierce and brave, or wise and gentle? Maybe a mix of both, like the stars in the sky.
assertive_mentor11: Hey, y_c! r_k needs fresh moss, could you grab it for {PRONOUN/r_k/object}?
Thanks, bud. Knew I could count on you. *Wink*
assertive_mentor12: y_c, no matter what happens, promise me you'll never let anyone make you feel bad about your choice to become a queen.
What we do here is just as essential as hunting or fighting for the Clan, if not even more so. The kits are the Clan's future, after all!
It's a serious job, and I expect you to take it seriously.
Even if it does entail playing the odd game of pretend with kits from time to time ... hehe.
assertive_mentor92: Surprise assessment, y_c! What's the first thing you should do when a queen goes into labor?
... What? That's not ... even remotely close.
*Sigh*. I was just doing this as a joke, but I guess I really have to show you again now ...
assertive_mentor93: Surprise assessment, y_c! What's the first thing you should do when a queen goes into labor?
I was just doing this as a joke, but turns out you're a lot smarter than you let on! Nice work, y_c.
assertive_mentor4: I noticed you helping r_k and r_k resolve their dispute the other day, and it really wasn't bad! You've come a long way. But, one thing I did notice was that you were a little too ... nice?
Not that you shouldn't be kind when trying to help the kits. That's not what I mean. But you shouldn't be too afraid to say what you really mean, either.
We're queens. It's our job to be honest with the kits, and instill in them the values that will guide them for the rest of their lives! Not protect their feelings.
Sometimes the kits will be unhappy with us, and that's just fine, so long as they're safe and healthy. You can't let anyone's opinion of you stop you from doing what's best.
Now, c'mon! I'll show you how a real pro does it.
assertive_mentor3: Something I've noticed about you, y_c, is that you think too much.

That's not exactly a bad thing, plenty of apprentices are hesitant, but when one of the kits needs your help, there's no time for thinking. You just have to see the problem in front of you, and go for it!
Then again, I can't even remember how many times I've been chewed out by the deputy for acting too rashly ...
I guess it's all about balance. You can't doubt yourself too much, but you can't be blinded by confidence, either.
It's a tough thing to master, but I know you can do it!
assertive_parent4_4: Hehe, quit trying to fix my fur, y_c!
I'm not a kit anymore, I know how to do it myself!
assertive_medapp2: Hey, y_c ... do you ever get lonely sleeping here in the medicine den all by yourself? I know I would ...
Tell you what, if you ever get scared or cold in the night, just come over to my den. You can sleep in my nest, with me. Okay?
broodingapp_toqueenapp: [You notice t_c playing with some kits, a rare smile on {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} face.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/seem/seems} to notice your gaze, pausing and accidentally stumbling over a kit.]
[Nodding, you look away. It's good to see {PRONOUN/t_c/object} having fun every once in a while.]
introspective_queenapp_2: Hm? Oh hello, y_c. What's wrong?
Why am I out of the nursery? You know I'm not stuck in there, right? I can actually leave.
I needed a break from all the action in there. There's lots going on, I needed a breather.
Me getting irritated at all the noise, and then snapping at the kits seriously doesn't seem like a good idea, does it? It's not their fault that they're excited.
So out here, I am. It's much much quieter, since most are out of camp at this time.
introspective_queenapp_5: [t_c is talking to a upset kit curled up against {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} side.]
You don't need to try and force yourself to be something you're not. I get tired of talking to others too.
You're still a wonderful part of this Clan. Even if you need space sometimes... You'll always have cats who want to be around you, and see you.
[You notice t_c is looking at you. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/smile/smiles} pleasantly, then {VERB/t_c/return/returns} {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} full attention to the kit.]
You'll never be forgotten, no matter what path your paws will lead you.
introspective_queen_to_NB: [You feel t_c's nose touch the top of your head.]
I hope you rested well. I wanted to check up on you, you're the last kit to wake up. Though that's unsurprising. You've got lots of growing to do, little one.
introspective_queen: No, I'm okay. I'm just out of the nursery, I needed to stretch my legs. I'm not currently needed, and I need to get out sometimes!
Sometimes you just need to get out, take a break from normality, you know? It'll give you appreciation for how your life currently is, without allowing you to become stagnant.
You never want to become too stuck in your own ways, being able to adapt is one of the best skills of being a Clan cat.
introspective_queen_1: y_c, Afternoon. How are you doing today?
I've been okay. Actually, you know, this has been on my mind recently.
Do you see having kits in your future? I understand this is a private question, so I'm not expecting an answer, but...
If you do, you'll be well looked after. I can promise you that. My job is to look after the parents, just as much as the kits. Especially if they're new parents.
You wouldn't need to worry about a thing, I'm always here for you, no matter what.
introspective_queen_2: y_c. It's nice to see you today, thank you for stopping by.
Hm. I've been thinking about the role I've chosen, being a queen.
The role of a permanent queen is fairly recent, Clan history speaking. Especially in comparison to roles like the medicine cat. And some were less...
Compassionate towards the role we perform, despite its importance.
Some viewed us as wasting Clan resources. A long time ago, the parent of the queen's role, a cat called Ferncloud, received some... uncomfortable comments from individuals related to her choice.

However, we do more than sit and play with kits, we help in ways medicine cats cannot. We're formally trained to recognise signs of illness in kits and queens, and to provide comfort in stressful situations.
I believe our constant presence with the kits helps us to realise something's wrong and get help before... The worst happens.
Just make sure to know that no matter what, everycat has their role to play. Don't be a cat who believes they're more important than those whose role is less flashy.
introspective_queen_3: y_c? Is everything okay? You look a little... down.
I know, I'm not a mediator, it's not necessarily my job to poke my nose in and bother cats about their problems.
But sometimes I feel talking to them can be a little... much. You know? It's very formal. Sometimes you may just want to talk to some with less... procedures?
I know I'm a queen, but I do love and care for everycat in this Clan, not just the kits.
Listen, if you need an ear, or some advice, or even just a shoulder to cry on, let me know. We can even go out of camp to talk, if you'd prefer privacy.
Just... don't suffer in silence, y_c. Some cats are really thinking of you, and love you a whole lot.
introspective_queen_4: Hello, y_c. Lovely to see you. Is something the matter?
... Yes, I understand that. Everycat needs a break every now and then. Wearing your paws and mind out with all that running isn't good for you.
How about you take a break here? There's plenty of space, and I'm sure the kits will enjoy being able to talk to someone else!
I'd like to think I'm good at telling stories, but I think they like hearing from cats with more... experience. You know what I mean?
So what do you say? Want to be a storyteller for a day?
introspective_queen_5: [t_c is sitting staring up at the sky in deep thought. You look up to see what {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} staring at, when a hawk swoops over the camp.]
Leave! You cannot have any of the kits!
[You walk over to make sure all the kits are okay.]
y_c, hello. Yes, we're all absolutely fine. I saw it coming, it's far worse at hunting than any of us are. Even me.
Yeah, I need to be very vigilant, if not, they'll swoop in and steal a kit, and I refuse to let them hurt anyone.
Hawks may be very beautiful to watch, but they're no joke when it comes to kit safety, y_c.
assertive_warrior_or_elder: After r_k walked in here with that live beetle, I genuinely thought I would lose it.
Without you here, y_c, I genuinely don't know what I would've done ... Died, probably. Like, actually died.
assertive_elder: Could you get some more moss for the corner nest? It's needed to be changed for, like, forever.
queen_kits: [Watching t_c play with the kits is like watching the most skilled hunter bring down a piece of prey, or watching the medicine cat heal a wound.]
[Never once did you ever think anyone could make the act of playing look so skilled and graceful ... But t_c somehow does everything perfectly.]
assertive_elder_3: Queens just went out for some fresh air ... which means, any moment now, we should hear -
assertive_elder_4: r_a's so big now ... StarClan, seems like just yesterday {PRONOUN/r_a/subject} {VERB/r_a/were/was} the size of my little paw.
Ain't it weird, watching generation after generation of kits grow up and make their lives?
No matter what, I'll always remember them as the kits we used to play with ... even if they end up being our bosses someday!
assertive_elder_5: y_c, what are you still doing in the nursery? It's time for your healing lesson!
You didn't think this job was just gonna be playing with kits all day, did you?
Maybe you can still make it to the medicine den if you hurry!
assertive_queensapp1: [As you watch t_c move around the nursery, it's easy to tell why {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} chose to become a queen.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/have/has} so much energy, it's almost like {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} still a kit {PRONOUN/t_c/self}!]
assertive_queensapp3: Hey, guess what time it is?
Do you REALLY, REALLY, REALLY wanna know?!
... It's time to take the herbs the medicine cat gave you for your tummy! Yaaaayyy!
[Grinning, t_c pushes the herbs towards you, and you find yourself feeling a little tricked.]
assertive_queensapp4: [t_c is currently being used as a climbing rock by all the kits in the nursery.]
Oh, hey, y_c! How's it - ACK! Hey, not the eyes, not the eyes!
[You ask if you should maybe come back another time?]
Oh, nah. This is nothing! Just wait until the hunting patrol gets back - that's when it gets really crazy around here!
So, is there something you nee-AHH! r_k, get off the tail!
assertive_queensapp4_2: Shh - Not too loud! The kits are sleeping.
Getting them down was such a nightmare ... Oh, but they're so cute, though.
Seeing them all curled up together like that ... All the headaches and pain suddenly seem worth it, don'tcha think?
assertive_queensapp5: Alright, alright, settle down! Time for a nap everybody, playtime's over!
That means you, too, y_c, no exceptions. You don't want Quietkit to get you, do you?
Who's Quietkit? Well, it's an interesting story ...

Once upon a time, there was a young kit named Quietkit who always stayed up past her bedtime. She was so tired that, one day, she fell asleep on her paws, and fell into a hole so deep, it went straight into the Dark Forest!
Now, her spirit haunts the nursery, waiting for more disobedient kits she can take down with her ...
Now, do you wanna be Quietkit's next playmate? Or do you wanna put the moss-ball down and get in your nest?
queens_app_general_newborn: Hi there, sweet kit. You're so precious.
upstanding_queenapp: Oh, hey there y_c! What are you doing up this early?
Hm. I guess that camp is pretty nice when you have it all to yourself. As for me, I've been a little busy making a few things for the kits.
[t_c nods to a pile of several carefully crafted playthings. Some are made out of feathers and twigs, others out of moss and leaves.]
Isn't it great? Sure, it was pretty hard to put together, and yeah, it might have taken me all night, but it'll be so worth it once I see the looks on their faces!
upstanding_queenapp1: Hey! C'mere you little furball! What did I tell you about leaving the nursery at this hour?
Ah ah, no buts! Rules are rules, and those rules say you are going straight back to the nursery!
sweet_queenapp_4: Hmhm, what do we have here? Oh, I couldn't possibly be stalked by a fearsome predator, could I?
Ah-! Oh, you got me! You were so stealthy, little one! Be careful jumping off of rocks like that though, you could get hurt!
Even the most fierce of warriors can get hurt by a big jump, so remember to take care of yourself!
sweet_queenapp_11: Oh, y_c! Just the cat I've been looking for. r_k made a gift for you, and {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} wanted me to bring it to you!
[It's a small stone, with berry juice hastily splattered onto it. Truly artistic.]

[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/pluck/plucks} the kitten off of you, giving you a sheepish look.]
Sorry about that! They've been pretty restless.
Hehe, I think someone needs some new toys to play with... so that the warriors don't become the toys.
sweet_queenapp_17: [You've been trying to get your duties done, but r_k has been trying to play all day.]
[{PRONOUN/r_k/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_k/'re/'s} very cute and you'd probably play with {PRONOUN/r_k/object} any other day, but l_n was practically begging you to finish this as soon as possible.]

I felt pretty unprepared when I became a queen's apprentice, though I do love my job! I don't want that for them.

assertivewarrior_leader5: y_c, I think I'm ready for an apprentice.

I know it's not for me to say, but I just figured I'd put a good word in.
Do keep in mind, will ya?
assertive_queensapp_9: r_w was in here earlier asking about kits ... I didn't know what to tell {PRONOUN/r_w/object}. Sorta weird that {PRONOUN/r_w/subject} {VERB/r_w/were/was} asking, no?
What do you think it means?

Ooh! Maybe {PRONOUN/r_w/subject}{VERB/r_w/'re/'s} in a forbidden relationship! A star-crossed love that can never be, with a rugged yet good-looking rogue who would do anything to protect {PRONOUN/r_w/object}!
*Sigh* ... Sorry, what was I talking about?
assertive_medapp: How's it going, mini-medicine cat? Herbal life treating you well?
Don't worry, I'm not going to run headfirst into trouble and injure myself today.
assertive_warrior_or_elder_3: StarClan, y_c, look at you ... could you really have been one of my kits here in the nursery just a few moons ago?
But, ah, no one can stay a kit forever, I suppose. And it's been such a joy, watching you grow.
You're always welcome here any time you need!
assertivewarriorapp_comfort: Just ... had a bad day, is all ...
*Sigh* y_c, have you ever felt like you're not enough for anyone?
Usually, when it comes to making a decision, I never hesitate. Whatever the obstacle, I'll run headfirst into it, no questions asked.
But, today, in the nursery, I was playing with one of the kits, and they accidentally got hurt ...
I just feel like such a failure. A liability. I can't help the way I am, but what if everycat's better off without me?
[You offer t_c words of reassurance, but {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/seem/seems} troubled beyond comforting.]

I just put them down for a nap, though, so be very quiet.
[You look in on the kits all curled together in a big pile of fluff. How did t_c tire them out so much?]
brooding_queen6: Oh, y_c. You here to visit the kits?

brooding_queen7: Nope. Not happening. You're not getting anywhere near the nursery.

brooding_queen9: [The kits may act wild around their parents, but they're always polite and well-mannered whenever t_c is near.]

brooding_queen10: It's past your bedtime, y_c. Into your nest, now.
Don't make me ask you again.
brooding_queen11: HEY! No running in the nursery! Don't you know better?
Go back and try again, slower this time.

brooding_queen12: y_c, if an unknown threat ever tries to enter the nursery, what should you do?
That's right. Run, hide, or find an adult to protect you.
No matter what, don't you ever, EVER try to fight it off by yourself.
You may be c_nClan, but you're no warrior. Not yet, at least.
Better to run and live to fight another day. It's advice that will take you far, all throughout your life. Don't forget it.
brooding_queen13: Okay, kits. Stop your playing. Time for your daily lesson.
Yes, y_c, you too. And I don't wanna hear any complaining, either.
These lessons are as important to your development as warriors as learning to fight or hunt. So listen up.
o_cClan is the Clan furthest away from us. We don't share any borders with them, but we still have some conflicts sometimes ...
[t_c soberly and evenly depicts the history, relations, and customs of your rival Clan, leaving out anything that might be inappropriate for your young kit ears.]

brooding_queen14: Here. I'll play with you. Roll the pebble over to me.

Y'know, I had a hard time making friends, too, at your age ...
Life isn't always easy for sensitive cats like us.
But you'll find your place in c_nClan, don't you worry.
And I'll always be here if you ever need a playmate.
newborn_unabashed: [t_c prods you with a paw, leaning forward to examine you.]

cool_newborn: Little y_c. I wonder what type of cat you'll become one day.

silly_queen_1: I love being a queen, y_c!

silly_queen_app1: You're getting so old! I'm really proud of you. I know you got it in ya to do real good things.
sweet_queen_1: Greetings, little friend! Welcome to the world. Let's get you situated, shall we?

sweet_queen_2: [t_c lets out a soft yawn, stretching as you tug at {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} tail for attention.]

wrong: Wrong. Go back to the edge of camp, and don't even think about going near the kits.
right: d_n, we have to change the password.
flatter: I'm flattered, but no. You're not getting to see the kits, even if you try.

TinyTeddy_stable_theyqueen_mentor_youque: they_queen

clan_has_kits
you_queen's_apprentice
[Feeling overwhelmed with the constant screaming and crying of the kits you quickly excuse yourself and stand outside the nursery. You take in a deep breath, your legs shake and your fur bristles.]
y_c, are you okay? Can we talk please?

[You nod hesitantly and follow t_c to a shaded area away from the nursery and any clanmates. Your ears are pinned back, your nose scrunched up as you hold your tongue, you fear that the words you'll say are... Not appropriate...]
You looked really upset, I understand that this can be a lot, especially for someone who's learning. It's not easy by any means. You're expected to do so much so quickly and all at once.
Could you please explain to me what happened? How you felt and what triggered that response?

['I just got overwhelmed... There was so much going on and I couldn't take it... It was loud and- r_k was crying all while r_w was trying to give some report... You were helping somecat and then a kit teasing another...']
['I just needed to breathe... I'm sorry.']
Don't apologise for acting maturely and taking action to prevent the situation from getting worse. Don't apologise for feeling that way or talking about it. You-

I'm proud of you, y_c. You did the right thing. You felt uncomfortable, you were worried that you might have snapped. That's exactly what I want to see in young cats. Maturity, discipline and awareness

Don't ever feel ashamed to take a quick breather and start with a fresh mind. That's something that all cats should practise and something the kits should learn from. I'm very proud of you and thank you for your honesty.
I'm going back inside, you're in no rush to get back to the nursery, take your time. I'll see you when you're ready.

they_stable
from_mentor
clan_has_kits
you_queen's_apprentice

y_c!
